stories.text:
As a developer one should be trained to learn and teach at a very high pace. If you want to publish a book, it should of course be related to your area of expertise. However, this can still be very broad.

How do you manage your market research when creating a book - or other forms of teaching content?
stories.title: Ask HN: (Self) Publishers: How do you research topics?

stories.text:
I would like to hire a Bitcoin Core Developer to teach me how to modify the Bitcoin Core Source Code, from tag v22.0, to implement a blockchain design with a different PoW scheme than sha2 hashing. This would involve writing and giving me a presentation on parameters, functions, files that need to be changed as well as coding the a new design. The goal is to go through one example with a different PoW in its entirety so that I can learn how that is done.

Compensation is negotiable. It can be on an hourly basis, or as a whole. The hourly rate would be $100/hour. I would imagine for a core developer who is intimately familiar with the source code this work would take less than 16 hours. I am a software developer. Languages mastery in order: C/C++/Python/TypeScript/x86_asm/Haskell --yes, x86 assembly is easier than Haskell :P.

Thank you.
stories.title: Bitcoin Core Developer for Consulting
